intro: Orbea valida subsp. valida, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, often with a contrasting throat. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Orbea valida subsp. valida is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and resilience.
